pokepower.name: Form Change
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Normal Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Normal Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) If you do, put Deoxys Normal Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Energy Crush
attack.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokemon.

attack.name: Hyper Beam
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Draco Meteor
attack.text: Flip a coin for each of your opponent's Pokemon. If that coin flip is heads, this attack does 50 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Destiny Bond
attack.text: Discard a {P} Energy attached to Froslass. During your opponent's next turn, if Froslass would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, the Attacking Pokemon is Knocked Out.

attack.name: Icy Breath
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep. Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Shadow Force
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Giratina during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Brutal Edge
attack.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Burning Poison
attack.text: Choose either Burned or Poisoned. The Defending Pokemon is now affected by that Special Condition. You may return Gliscor and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attack.name: Pester
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

pokepower.name: Flash Fire

attack.name: Magma Storm
attack.text: You may discard as many basic Energy cards as you like attached to Heatran. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

attack.name: Aqua Stream
attack.text: Search your discard pile for as many {W} Energy cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and this attack does 10 damage for each {W} Energy card you chose. Put those cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Dragon Pump
attack.text: You may discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokebody.name: Rivalry
pokebody.text: If your opponent has any Pokemon LV.X in play, each of Luxray's attacks does 50 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Plasma
attack.text: Search your discard pile for a {L} Energy card and attach it to Luxray.

attack.name: Shock Bolt
attack.text: Discard all {L} Energy attached to Luxray.

attack.name: Ice Fang
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Charge Through
attack.text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage and 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If you do, Mamoswine does 40 damage to itself.

pokepower.name: Magnetic Reversal
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with 1 of the Defending Pokemon. This power can't be used if Metagross is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Extra Comet Punch
attack.text: During your next turn, Metagross's Extra Comet Punch attack's base damage is 100.

attack.name: Hypnoblast
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Psychic
attack.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

pokebody.name: Happy Sign
pokebody.text: If you have Poliwag, Poliwhirl, and Poliwrath in play, each of these Pokemon's attacks does 60 more damage to the Defending Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Frog Jump
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

pokebody.name: Steel Coating
pokebody.text: Any damage done to Probopass by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 10 for each {M} Energy attached to Probopass (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't reduce more than 20 damage in this way.

attack.name: Metal Bomber
attack.text: Choose a number of your opponent's Benched Pokemon up to the amount of {M} Energy attached to Probopass. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokepower.name: Speed Gain
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic {R} Energy card or a basic {L} Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza. This power can't be used if Rayquaza is affected by a Special Condition. You can't use more than 1 Speed Gain Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Sky Judgment
attack.text: Discard all Energy attached to Rayquaza.

pokebody.name: Slow Start
pokebody.text: Regigigas can't attack until your opponent has 3 or less Prize cards left.

attack.name: Crush Grip
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 120.

pokepower.name: Curse Breath
pokepower.text: Once during your turn, when you put Spiritomb from your hand onto your Bench, you may put 1 damage counter on all Pokemon that already have any damage counters on them (both yours and your opponent's). You can't use more than 1 Curse Breath Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Transfer Pain
attack.text: Move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokemon to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.

attack.name: Sonic Wave
attack.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Pursue and Turn
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and switch Yanmega with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

pokebody.name: Fossil Armor
pokebody.text: If Armaldo would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Armaldo if that damage is 60 or less.

attack.name: Crush Claw
attack.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage.

pokepower.name: Time Walk
pokepower.text: Once during your turn, when you put Azelf from your hand onto your Bench, you may look at all of your face-down Prize cards. If you do, you may choose 1 Pokemon you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Then, choose 1 card in your hand and put it as a Prize card face down.

attack.name: Lock Up
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Parallel Gain
attack.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokemon.

attack.name: Blend Pollen
attack.text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Vileplume and each Bellossom you have in play. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

attack.name: Drain Down
attack.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokemon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. If you do, this attack does 30 damage to the new Defending Pokemon. If the Defending Pokemon would be Knocked Out by this attack, you may remove all damage counters from Cradily.

attack.name: Acid
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Gripthrow
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent returns the Defending Pokemon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand.

attack.name: Prop-up Pinchers
attack.text: If Crawdaunt has a Technical Machine card attached to it, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

pokebody.name: Attracting Body
pokebody.text: If Delcatty is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Delcatty is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

attack.name: Energy Assist
attack.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

pokepower.name: Form Change
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Attack Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Attack Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) If you do, put Deoxys Attack Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Psychic Boost
attack.text: During your next turn, Deoxys's Psychic Boost attack's base damage is 20.

pokepower.name: Form Change
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Defense Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Defense Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) If you do, put Deoxys Defense Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Psychic Defense
attack.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of an attack, and any damage done to Deoxys by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

pokepower.name: Form Change
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Speed Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Speed Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) If you do, put Deoxys Speed Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Speed Shot
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokemon.

pokebody.name: Ditto DNA
pokebody.text: As long as Ditto is your Active Pokemon, its maximum HP is the same as your opponent's Active Pokemon. Ditto can use the attacks of that Pokemon as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

pokebody.name: Iron Shell
pokebody.text: Whenever you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to Forretress (excluding effects of attacks), flip a coin. If tails, put 2 damage counters on each Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding any Forretress).

attack.name: Explosion
attack.text: Forretress does 40 damage to itself.

attack.name: Drought
attack.text: Choose up to 2 basic {F} Energy cards from your hand and attach them to 1 of your Pokemon.

attack.name: Major Earthquake
attack.text: Discard 2 {F} Energy attached to Groudon and this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokepower.name: Smelt

attack.name: Heavy Metal
attack.text: Flip a coin for each {M} Energy attached to Heatran. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attack.name: One Desire
attack.text: Search your deck for any 1 card. Shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of your deck.

attack.name: Doom Desire
attack.text: Discard all Energy attached to Jirachi. The Defending Pokemon is Knocked Out at the end of your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Drizzle
attack.text: Choose up to 2 basic {W} Energy cards from your hand and attach them to 1 of your Pokemon.

attack.name: High Tide
attack.text: Discard 2 {W} Energy attached to Kyogre. This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokebody.name: Healing Tail
pokebody.text: As long as Lopunny is your Active Pokemon, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Benched Pokemon between turns.

attack.name: Collect
attack.text: Draw 3 cards.

attack.name: Cross-Cut
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon is an Evolved Pokemon, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

pokepower.name: Psychic Bind
pokepower.text: Once during your turn, when you put Mesprit from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this power. Your opponent can't use any Poke-Powers on his or her Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Extrasensory
attack.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

attack.name: Focus Punch
attack.text: If Poliwrath was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does nothing.

attack.name: Submission
attack.text: Poliwrath does 20 damage to itself.

pokepower.name: Regi Move
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Discard 2 cards from your hand and choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokemon that isn't an Evolved Pokemon. Your opponent switches that Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon. This power can't be used if Regice is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Ice Reflect
attack.text: If Regice was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

pokebody.name: Recover Mechanism
pokebody.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to Regigigas, remove all Special Conditions from Regigigas.

attack.name: Gigaton Punch
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokepower.name: Regi Cycle
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have a {F} Energy card in your discard pile, you may discard 2 cards from your hand. Then, attach a {F} Energy card from your discard pile to Regirock. This power can't be used if Regirock is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Stone Edge
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

pokepower.name: Regi Heal
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 2 cards from your hand. Then, remove 3 damage counters from Registeel. This power can't be used if Registeel is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Rotating Claws
attack.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Registeel. If you do, search your discard pile for an Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to Registeel.

pokepower.name: Resent
pokepower.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Shedinja would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon and each of your opponent's Pokemon that has the same name as the Attacking Pokemon.

attack.name: Curse and Deceive
attack.text: Put 3 damage counters on the Defending Pokemon. If Shedinja has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

pokebody.name: White Smoke
pokebody.text: As long as Torkoal is your Active Pokemon, prevent all effects, including damage, done to your Benched Pokemon by your opponent's attacks.

attack.name: Black Soot
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned and Paralyzed.

pokepower.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown ! from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. If tails, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your Pokemon.

attack.name: Hidden Power
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Unown ! does 10 damage to itself, and this attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

pokepower.name: Set Up
pokepower.text: Once during your turn, when you put Uxie from your hand onto your Bench, you may draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

attack.name: Psychic Restore
attack.text: You may put Uxie and all cards attached to it on the bottom of your deck in any order.

attack.name: Burning Scent
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Burned and Poisoned. Before applying these effects, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokemon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. The new Defending Pokemon is now Burned and Poisoned.

attack.name: Energy Dissolve
attack.text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

pokepower.name: Energy Reaction
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a {G} or {P} Energy card from your hand to Vileplume (excluding effects of attacks or Poke-Powers), you may use this power. If you attach a {G} Energy card, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep. If you attach a {P} Energy card, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Disturbing Pollen
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Guard Claw
attack.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Anorith by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: X-Scissor
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attack.name: Eruption
attack.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

attack.name: Take Down
attack.text: Camerupt does 20 damage to itself.

pokepower.name: Temperament
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform. (Any cards attached to Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) If you do, put Castform on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Weather Ball
attack.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, remove 3 damage counters from Castform. If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

pokepower.name: Temperament
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Rain Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Rain Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) Shuffle Castform Rain Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Water Pulse
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

pokepower.name: Temperament
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Snow-cloud Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Snow-cloud Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) Shuffle Castform Snow-cloud Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Hailstone
attack.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokepower.name: Temperament
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Sunny Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Sunny Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) Shuffle Castform Sunny Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Ember
attack.text: Discard a {R} Energy attached to Castform Sunny Form.

attack.name: Wrap
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Rising Lunge
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attack.name: Expand
attack.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Drifblim by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Whirlwind
attack.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Psychic Strategy
attack.text: Each player counts the number of cards in his or her opponent's hand. Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player draws a number of cards equal to the number of cards his or her opponent had.

attack.name: Super Eggsplosion
attack.text: Discard as many Energy cards as you like attached to your Pokemon. For each Energy card you discarded, flip a coin. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Poison Jab
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attack.name: Sharp Tail
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.

attack.name: Magical Step
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused. Put 6 damage counters instead of 3 on the Confused Pokemon.

attack.name: Grind
attack.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Grumpig.

pokebody.name: Revenge Fang
pokebody.text: If you have less Benched Pokemon than your opponent, each of Houndoom's attacks does 40 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Burning Sensation
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

attack.name: Bright Flame
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 {R} Energy attached to Houndoom.

attack.name: Strong Current
attack.text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon to another of your opponent's Pokemon.

attack.name: Confuse Ray
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

attack.name: Energy Split
attack.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Aqua Bolt
attack.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each {W} Energy attached to Lanturn.

attack.name: Comet Punch
attack.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Baton Pass
attack.text: You may switch Ledian with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. If you do, move as many Energy cards attached to Ledian as you like to the new Active Pokemon.

attack.name: Focus Blast
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Spike Lariat
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

attack.name: Spark
attack.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Thunderous Claw
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all {L} Energy attached to Luxio.

attack.name: Heavy Bone
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Marowak can't use Heavy Bone during your next turn.

attack.name: Bone Rush
attack.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Agility
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Metang during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Psyshock
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Bullet Punch
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attack.name: Bite On
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon isn't an Evolved Pokemon, that Pokemon can't attack, retreat, or use any Poke-Powers during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Pick On
attack.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokemon you have in play.

pokepower.name: Cast-off Shell
pokepower.text: Once during your turn, when you play Ninjask from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon and if your Bench isn't full, you may put Shedinja onto your Bench as a Basic Pokemon from your hand or your discard pile.

attack.name: Chip Off
attack.text: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in his or her hand, discard a number of cards without looking until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand.

attack.name: Feint Attack
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokemon.

attack.name: Fasten Claws
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage.

attack.name: Charge Dash
attack.text: You may do 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, Piloswine does 30 damage to itself.

attack.name: Icy Wind
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Aqua Pump
attack.text: You may discard up to 2 {W} Energy cards from your hand. If you do, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

attack.name: Star Boomerang
attack.text: You may return Starmie and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attack.name: Core Flash
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that has any Poke-Powers or Poke-Bodies. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Swallow Up
attack.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokemon and Swalot. If the Defending Pokemon has fewer remaining HP than Swalot's, this attack does 80 damage instead.

attack.name: Gunk Shot
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

pokebody.name: Big Wing
pokebody.text: If Swellow has no Energy attached to it, Swellow's Retreat Cost is 0.

attack.name: Mach Descent
attack.text: If you played Swellow from your hand during this turn, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

attack.name: Herd Charge
attack.text: Flip a coin for each Tauros you have in play. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Thrash
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, Tauros does 10 damage to itself.

attack.name: Tentacle Strike
attack.text: Search your opponent's discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to any of your opponent's Pokemon in any way you like. For each Energy card attached in this way, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Dangerous Poison
attack.text: If Tentacruel has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokemon, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

pokepower.name: JUNK
pokepower.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown J from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attack.name: Hidden Power
attack.text: Remove the Special Condition Asleep from the Defending Pokemon.

pokepower.name: RETIRE
pokepower.text: Once during your turn, if Unown R is on your Bench, you may discard Unown R and all cards attached to it. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokemon.) Then, draw a card.

attack.name: Hidden Power
attack.text: Move any number of basic Energy cards attached to your Pokemon to your other Pokemon in any way you like.

pokebody.name: UNSEEN
pokebody.text: As long as Unown U is on your Bench, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done by your opponent's Pokemon to any Unown on your Bench.

attack.name: Hidden Power
attack.text: Search your deck for any 1 card and discard it. Shuffle your deck afterward.

pokepower.name: VACATION
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 2 damage counters from each of your Pokemon. If you do, your turn ends. This power can't be used if Unown V is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Hidden Power
attack.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokebody.name: WALL
pokebody.text: As long as Unown W is your Active Pokemon, any damage done to your Pokemon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Hidden Power
attack.text: Draw a card.

pokepower.name: YAWN
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown Y is on your Bench, you may remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Active Unown and that Unown is now Asleep.

attack.name: Hidden Power
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown ? is on your Bench, you may choose a Pokemon in your hand and put it face down. Your opponent guesses a type of that Pokemon. Reveal that card. If your opponent guessed wrong, draw a card. Then, put that card back into your hand.

attack.name: Hidden Power
attack.text: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. For each card you discarded, draw a card.

pokepower.name: Metal Chain
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a {M} Energy card from your hand to Beldum (excluding effects of attacks or Poke-Powers), you may search your deck for Beldum and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Beldum is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Take Down

attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

attack.name: Hypnosis

attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attack.name: Jump On
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attack.name: Poison Sting
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attack.name: Sleep Powder
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Frustration
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Space Out
attack.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Gloom. Gloom is now Asleep.

attack.name: Stinky Nectar
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attack.name: Amnesia
attack.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. That Pokemon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Gastro Acid
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Counter Punch
attack.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Hitmonchan is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Hitmonchan is Knocked Out), put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon.

attack.name: Gut Strike
attack.text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmonchan, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

attack.name: Gut Kick
attack.text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmonlee, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokemon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Triple Kick
attack.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Gut Spin
attack.text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmontop, you may switch Hitmontop with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Smokescreen
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attack.name: Fury Swipes

attack.name: Singe

attack.name: Poisonpowder
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attack.name: Selfdestruct

attack.name: Spin
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Bubblebeam
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Corner
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attack.name: Double Kick
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Growl

attack.name: Rob
attack.text: Look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent has any Pokemon Tool or Technical Machine cards in his or her hand, put those cards on top of his or her deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

attack.name: Psybeam
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

attack.name: Bounce
attack.text: You may switch Spoink with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Recover
attack.text: Discard an Energy attached to Staryu and remove 3 damage counters from Staryu.

attack.name: Sniff Out
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

attack.name: Focus Energy
attack.text: During your next turn, Taillow's Peck attack's base damage is 30.

attack.name: Crystal Barrier
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Tentacool during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Mysterious Beam
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

pokepower.name: Baby Evolution
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Hitmonlee, Hitmonchan, or Hitmontop from your hand onto Tyrogue (this counts as evolving Tyrogue) and remove all damage counters from Tyrogue.

attack.name: Gut Blow
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon is an Evolved Pokemon, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and Tyrogue does 10 damage to itself.

attack.name: Poisonpowder
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attack.name: U-turn
attack.text: Switch Yanma with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Agility
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Yanma during your opponent's next turn.

trainer.text: Attach Bubble Coat to 1 of your Pokemon that doesn't already have a Pokemon Tool attached to it. If that Pokemon is Knocked Out, discard this card. As long as Bubble Coat is attached to a Pokemon, that Pokemon has no Weakness. If that Pokemon is damaged by an opponent's attack, discard this card at the end of the turn.

supporter.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokemon. When your turn ends, discard this card. Draw 2 cards. As long as Buck's Training is next to your Active Pokemon, each of your Active Pokemon's attacks does 10 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokemon. When your turn ends, discard this card. Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, draw 4 more cards.

trainer.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokemon.

Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose as many Pokemon as you like, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

stadium.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card. Each Pokemon that isn't an Evolved Pokemon in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets +20 HP.

This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card. Once during each player's turn, that player may choose a {R} or {F} Energy attached to 1 of his or her Pokemon and move that Energy to 1 of his or her {R} or {F} Pokemon.

trainer.text: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokemon in play. That Pokemon may use this card's attack instead of its own.
Attach this card to 1 of your Pokemon in play. That Pokemon may use this card's attack instead of its own.

Play Claw Fossil as if it were a {C} Basic Pokemon. (Claw Fossil counts as a Trainer cards as well, but if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokemon.) Claw Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Claw Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokemon.) [Poke-Body] Jagged Stone If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokemon.

Play Root Fossil as if it were a {C} Basic Pokemon. (Root Fossil counts as a Trainer cards as well, but if Root Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokemon.) Root Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Root Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokemon.) [Poke-Body] Spongy Stone At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil.

attack.name: Deep Balance
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. Put 1 damage counter on that Pokemon for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokemon.

attack.name: Night Slash
attack.text: You may switch Gliscor with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Cyber Shock
attack.text: Discard a {L} Energy and a {M} Energy attached to Magnezone. The Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attack.text: Discard all Energy attached to Mewtwo.
